title: Please help me understand why i was banned?

replies.body:
Hey SDX1 --

I took a look at the detection and while you may not have specifically cheated, the person you regularly share the account with definitely was. Please note that account sharing isn't allowed as you are ultimately responsible for any actions that happen on the account. Unfortunately we will not be lifting the ban. If you share any other accounts, please protect yourself and change the passwords on them as soon as possible.

A reminder for everyone out there: **never share your credentials with anyone!**

I am always curious how you are able to detect when someone is cheating. Is it a case of "Rule one: Never talk about how you detect cheating", or are you able to shed any light on this?

I am not riot but basic knowledge of thiscomes out of "data mining" and "anomaly detection".

The data mining i am talking about is not what moobeat does on s@20, datamining means finding a pattern in data; in this case, the playstyle can emerge upon looking at hundreds of games as well as average performand and other stuff.

That said there is also "anomaly detection", where you take in account border cases that are not normal and see if those coincide with other kind of data, to see if that it just an exception or is an anomaly with some causes behind. This system is used also to detect bank frauds.

For example, let' s say our OP here plays mostly X and Y role and he is meh at Z, and the system detects that sometimes while it plays Z role he acts differently. That alone is not enough, obviously people act differently according to champion, but if the game detecs some odd behavious that pairs up with that, like swapping smite and flash or being from very chatty to almost silent or playing in weird hours then something can emerge.
